summary: John Dee Jay is an individual who appears to have been of counter-intelligence interest in 1972. He is described as attempting to solicit official information from members of the 66th USA Artillery Detachment in Soest, Federal Republic of Germany. He also inquired about former unit members and mentioned a 'package' for Cristobal Pimentel-Davilla. The incidents involving John Dee Jay prompted investigations by the 165th MI CO and the 66th MI Group.
significance: Based on the provided documents, John Dee Jay's significance to the JFK assassination context is unclear. The documents suggest he was under counter-intelligence scrutiny in the 1970s for attempting to gather information from military personnel, but there is no direct indication of any connection to the JFK assassination.
